results.title: Protective effect of high dose short term statin therapy with normal saline in prevention of contrast-induced nephropathy among iodixanol-receiving patients
results.text_hl: Data were analyzed using t-test and paired  t-test between both groups. The effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Extravasation_of_Diagnostic_and_Therapeutic_Materials</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005119 @@@contrast nephropathy@@@ was evaluated based on any statically significant change in GFR.

citations.NLM: Sanadgol H, Abdani S, Tabatabaiee P, Mohammadi M. Protective effect of high dose short term statin therapy with normal saline in prevention of contrast-induced nephropathy among iodixanol-receiving patients J Renal Inj Prev. 2012;1(1):43-5. PMID: 25340104

results.title: Comparison of usefulness of simvastatin 20 mg versus 80 mg in preventing contrast-induced nephropathy in patients with acute coronary syndrome undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 80 mg before PCI could further decrease the occurrence of @<m>DISEASE_Extravasation_of_Diagnostic_and_Therapeutic_Materials</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005119 @@@contrast-induced nephropathy@@@ compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20 mg.

citations.NLM: Xinwei J, Xianghua F, Jing Z, Xinshun G, Ling X, Weize F, Guozhen H, Yunfa J, Weili W, Shiqiang L. Comparison of usefulness of simvastatin 20 mg versus 80 mg in preventing contrast-induced nephropathy in patients with acute coronary syndrome undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention. Am J Cardiol. 2009 Aug 15;104(4):519-24. PMID: 19660605

results.title: Simvastatin Attenuates Contrast-Induced Nephropathy through Modulation of Oxidative Stress, Proinflammatory Myeloperoxidase, and Nitric Oxide
results.text_hl: The protective effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SSTN@@@ against @<m>DISEASE_Extravasation_of_Diagnostic_and_Therapeutic_Materials</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005119 @@@CM@@@ can be attributed to its antioxidant property.
